doc.previous: The William J. Clinton Presidential Center and Park in Little Rock, Arkansas was dedicated in 2004.[213] Clinton released a best-selling autobiography, My Life in 2004.[214] In 2007, he released Giving: How Each of Us Can Change the World, which also became a The New York Times Best Seller and garnered positive reviews.[215]
doc.after: In the aftermath of the 2004 Asian tsunami, U.N. Secretary-General Kofi Annan appointed Clinton to head a relief effort.[216] After Hurricane Katrina, Clinton joined with fellow former President George H. W. Bush to establish the Bush-Clinton Tsunami Fund in January 2005, and the Bush-Clinton Katrina Fund in October of that year.[217] As part of the tsunami effort, these two ex-presidents appeared in a Super Bowl XXXIX pre-game show,[218] and traveled to the affected areas.[219] They also spoke together at the funeral of Boris Yeltsin in 2007.[220]
